content.description: Four identical disks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> each rotate with initial angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> in the counterclockwise direction. content.question: Considering counterclockwise to be the direction of positive torque, which disk will have the greatest angular speed at time <math alttext="t sub f" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mi>f</mi> </msub> </math>?

choices.label: The figure is titled “Disk A” and shows the graph of a sinusoidal curve in the first and fourth quadrants of a gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled “t, in seconds,” and the value t sub f is indicated 8 units to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled “tau, in newton meters.” The curve begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right to a peak at coordinates 2 comma 2, then moves downward and to the right, intercepts the horizontal axis at 4 units, reaches a trough at coordinates 6 comma negative 2, then moves back upward and to the right and intercepts the horizontal axis at 8 units, which is also the value t sub f.

The figure is titled “Disk B” and shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled “t, in seconds,” and the value t sub f is indicated 8 units to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled “tau, in newton meters.” The line begins at coordinates 0 comma negative 2, moves upward and to the right, intercepts the horizontal axis at 3 units, and ends directly above t sub f at coordinates 8 comma 3.

The figure is titled “Disk C” and shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled 0. The horizontal axis is labeled “t, in seconds,” and the value t sub f is indicated 8 units to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled “tau, in newton meters.” The line begins at coordinates 0 comma 1.5, moves horizontally to the right, and ends at coordinates 9 comma 1.5.

The figure is titled “Disk D” and shows the graph of a line that consists of 3 connected line segments in the fourth quadrant of a gridded coordinate plane with the origin labeled 0. The vertical axis is labeled “tau, in newton meters.” The line begins at coordinates 0 comma negative 2, moves horizontally to the right to coordinates 6 comma negative 2, then moves vertically upward to coordinates 6 comma 0, then moves horizontally to the right and ends at coordinates 9 comma 0.
